meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'grum': surly or ill-tempered in appearance or manner.
meanings.sent1: The grummer man scowled at everyone passing by.
meanings.sent2: She felt grummer than usual after a long day at work.
meanings.sent3: The grummer expression on his face made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The grummer tone of his voice sent shivers down her spine.
meanings.sent5: The grummer clouds in the sky foretold a storm approaching.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'grum': gloomy or sullen in disposition.
meanings.sent1: The grummer weather matched his somber mood.
meanings.sent2: Her grummer attitude affected the whole group.
meanings.sent3: Despite his grummer demeanor, he secretly loved comedies.
meanings.sent4: The grummer atmosphere in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The grummer shadows cast a sense of foreboding over the town.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'grum': harsh or unpleasant in sound.
meanings.sent1: The grummer noise of the construction site kept her up all night.
meanings.sent2: The grummer music blared from the car speakers.
meanings.sent3: The grummer sound of the alarm clock startled him awake.
meanings.sent4: The grummer screech of the brakes made her cringe.
meanings.sent5: The grummer wind howled through the trees, creating an eerie atmosphere.
